question: You cannot pass!
answer: Gandalf!

question: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the Flame of Anor! Argh! Go back to the shadow. The Dark Fire will not avail you, Flame of Udn! YOU SHALL NOT... PASS!!! Argh!
answer: Gandalf!

question: Fly, you fools!
answer: Noooooooooooooooo!!!! Gaaandaaaaalf!! Gandalf!

question: Noooooooooooooooo!!!! Gaaandaaaaalf!! Gandalf!
answer: What is it, Mr. Frodo?

question: Nothing. Just a dream.
answer: Mordor. The one place in Middle-earth we dont want to see any closer, and the one place were trying to get to. Its just where we cant get. Lets face it, Mr. Frodo, were lost. I dont think Gandalf meant for us to come this way.

question: He didnt mean for a lot of things to happen, Sam... but they did.
answer: Mr. Frodo? Its the Ring, isnt it?

question: Its getting heavier. What food have we got left?
answer: Well, let me see. Oh yes, lovely  Lembas bread. And look! More lembas bread. I don't usually hold with foreign food, but this Elvish stuff, its not bad.

question: Nothing ever dampens your spirits, does it Sam?
answer: Those rain clouds might. This looks strangely familiar.

question: Its because weve been here before! Were going in circles.
answer: Ah! What's that 'orrid stink? I'll warrant there's a nasty bog nearby. Can you smell it?

question: Maybe he does deserve to die, but now that I see him, I do pity him.
answer: We be nice to them if they be nice to us. Take it off us. We swears to do what you wants. We swears.

question: Theres no promise you can make that I can trust.
answer: We swears to serve the master of the preciousss. We swears on... on the precious. *Gollum. Gollum.*

question: The Ring is treacherous. It will hold you to your word.
answer: Yes... on the preciousss. On the preciousss.

question: You know the way to Mordor?
answer: Yes...

question: Youve been there before?
answer: Yes...

question: Merry! Merry!
answer: I think... we might have made a mistake leaving the Shire, Pippin.

question: Whats making that noise?
answer: Its the trees.

question: What?
answer: Do you remember the Old Forest? On the borders of Buckland? Folk used to say that there was something in the water that made the trees grow tall... and come alive.

question: Alive?
answer: Trees that could whisper. Talk to each other. Even move. Pippin, lets go. Pippin!

question: Merry!
answer: Hooooo...

question: Argh!! Run, Merry!
answer: Little Orcs! Burrum...

question: Its talking, Merry. The tree is talking!
answer: Tree?! I am no tree. I am an Ent.

question: Side? I am on nobodys side because nobodys on my side, little Orc. Nobody cares for the woods anymore.
answer: Were not Orcs. Were Hobbits!

question: Hobbits? Never heard of a hobbit before. Sounds like Orc mischief to me! They come with fire, they come with axes. Gnawing, biting, breaking, hacking, burning! Destroyers and usurpers, curse them!
answer: No, you dont understand. Were Hobbits... Halflings! Shirefolk!

question: See, see, we have led you out! Hurry hobbitses hurry. Very lucky we find you. Nice hobbit.
answer: Whoa, its a bog! Hes led us into a swamp!

question: A swamp, yes, yes. Come, master. We will take you on safe paths through the mist. Come, hobbits, come. We go quickly. I found it, I did. The way through the marshes. Orcs don't use it. Orcs don't know it. They go round for miles and miles. Come quickly. Swift and quick as shadows we must be.
answer: There are dead things! Dead faces in the water!

question: All dead. All rotten. Elves and men and orcses. A great battle long ago. The Dead Marshes. Yes, yes that is their name. This way. Dont follow the lights.
answer: Ohh!

question: Careful now, or hobbits go down to join the dead ones and light little candles of their own.
answer: Frodo!

question: Sooo bright. Sooo beautiful. our preciousss...
answer: What did you say?

question: Master should be resting. Master needs to keep up his strength.
answer: Who are you?

question: Mustnt ask us. Not its business. *Gollum, Gollum*
answer: Gandalf told me you were one of the River Folk.

question: Cold be heart and hand and bone. Cold be travellers far from home.
answer: He said your life was a sad story.

question: They do not see what lies ahead, when sun has failed and moon is dead.
answer: You were not so very different from a hobbit once, were you... Smagol?

question: What did you call me?
answer: That was your name once, wasnt it? A long time ago.

question: Cmon Frodo! C'mon!
answer: Quick! They will see us! They will see us!

question: I thought they were dead!
answer: Dead? No, you cannot kill them. No. Wraiths! Wraiths on wings! They are calling for it. They are calling for the preciousss.

question: Mr. Frodo! Its alright. Im here.
answer: Hurry, hobbits. The Black Gate is very close.

question: Hes led us this far, Sam.
answer: Mr. Frodo, no.

question: Hes been true to his word.
answer: No!

question: Edoras and the Golden Hall of Meduseld. There dwells Thoden, King of Rohan, whose mind is overthrown. Sarumans hold over King Thoden is now very strong. Be careful what you say. Do not look for welcome here.
answer: Youll find more cheer in a graveyard.

question: Ah. Hmm? Oh. You would not part an old man from his walking stick? The courtesy of your hall is somewhat lessened of late, Thoden King. Be silent! Keep your forked tongue behind you teeth. I have not passed through fire and death to bandy crooked words with a witless worm! Thoden, son of Thengel, too long have you sat in the shadows.
answer: I would stay still, if I were you.

question: Hearken to me! I release you from the spell. I will draw you, Saruman, as poison is drawn from a wound.
answer: Wait.

question: You did not kill me, you will not kill him! Be gone!! Breathe the free air again, my friend. Your fingers would remember their old strength better... if they grasped your sword.
answer: No, my lord! No, my lord. Let him go. Enough blood has been spilled on his account.

question: Thodreds death was not of your making. He was strong in life. His spirit will find its way to the halls of your fathers. Westu hl. Feru, Thodred, Feru. This is but a taste of the terror that Saruman will unleash. All the more potent for he is driven now by fear of Sauron. Ride out and meet him head on. Draw him away from your women and children. You must fight.
answer: You have two thousand good men riding north as we speak. omer is loyal to you. His men will return and fight for their king. Open war is upon you. Whether you would risk it or not.

question: Hes only doing what he thinks is best for his people. Helms Deep has saved them in the past.
answer: There is no way out of that ravine. Thoden is walking into a trap. He thinks hes leading them to safety. What they will get is a massacre. Thoden has a strong will but I fear for him. I fear for the survival of Rohan. He will need you before the end, Aragorn. The people of Rohan will need you. The defences HAVE to hold.

question: They will hold.
answer: The Grey Pilgrim... thats what they used to call me. Three hundred lives of men Ive walked this earth and now I have no time. With luck, my search will not be in vain. Look to my coming at first light on the fifth day. At dawn, look to the East.

question: Hey Stinker! Dont go getting too far ahead!
answer: Why do you do that?

question: What?
answer: Call him names; run him down all the time.

question: Because because that's what he is, Mr. Frodo. There's naught left in 'im but lies and deceit. It's the Ring he wants. It's all he cares about.
answer: You have no idea what it did to him. What its still doing to him. I want to help him, Sam...

question: Why?
answer: Because I have to believe he can come back.

question: You cant save him, Mr. Frodo.
answer: What do you know about it? Nothing! I'm sorry, Sam. I don't know why I said that.

question: I do. It's the Ring. You can't take your eyes off it. I've seen you. You're not eating. You barely sleep. It's taken a hold of you, Mr Frodo. You have to fight it!
answer: I know what I have to do Sam. The Ring was entrusted to me! It's my task! Mine! My own!

question: Cant you hear yourself? Dont you know who you sound like?
answer: We wants it. We needs it. Must have the precioussss. They stole it from us. Sneaky little hobbitsesss. Wicked, trickssssy, falssse! Yes, precious. False. They will cheat you, hurt you, lie. You dont have any friends. Nobody likes YOU... Youre a liar and a thief. Murderer! Go away! HAHAHAHA!! Where would you be without me? *Gollum, gollum*. I saved us. It was me. We survived because of me! What did you say? What? No!! Arrrgh!!!

question: Youll make him sick, you will, behaving like that! Theres only one way to eat a brace of coneys. Whats to ruin? Theres hardly any meat on em. What we need is a few good taters.
answer: Whats taters, preciousss? Whats taters uh?

question: PO-TAY-TOES! Boil em. Mash em. Stick em in a stew. Lovely big golden chips with a nice piece of fried fish.... Even you couldnt say no to that. Youre hopeless. Mr. Frodo? Who are they?
answer: Wicked men. Servants of Sauron. They are called to Mordor. The Dark One is gathering all armies to him. It wont be long now. He will soon be ready.

question: Ready to do what?
answer: To make his war. The last war that will cover all the world in shadow.

question: The light of the Evenstar does not wax and wane It is mine to give to whom I will... Like my heart Go to sleep...
answer: I am asleep. This is a dream.

question: Then it is a good dream. Sleep
answer: Min l pennich nin i aur hen telitha.

question: i vethed... n i onnad. Boe bedich go Frodo. Han bd ln.
answer: Dolen i vd o nin.

question: Si peliannen i vd na dail ln. Si boe -dhannathach.
answer: Arwen

question: Our time here is ending. Arwens time is ending. Let her go. Let her take the ship into the west. Let her bear away her love for you to the Undying Lands. There it will be evergreen.
answer: But never more than a memory.

question: I will not leave my daughter here to die.
answer: She stays because she still has hope.

question: She stays for YOU! She belongs with her people!
answer: Idhren emmen menna gui ethwel. Hae o auth a nr a naeth.

question: Idhren emmen menna gui ethwel. Hae o auth a nr a naeth.
answer: Why are you saying this?

question: I am mortal; you are Elfkind. It was a dream, Arwen, nothing more. This belongs to you.
answer: It was a gift. Keep it.

question: Arwen. Tollen i l. I chair gwannar na Valannor. Si bado, no crar.
answer: I have made my choice.

question: He is not coming back. Why do you linger here when there is no hope?
answer: There is still hope.

question: If Aragorn survives this war, you will still be parted. If Sauron is defeated, and Aragorn made king and all that you hope for comes true, you will still have to taste the bitterness of mortality. Whether by the sword or the slow decay of time, Aragorn will die. And there will be no comfort for you. No comfort to ease the pain of his passing. He will come to death, an image of the splendor of the kings of men in glory undimmed before the breaking of the world. But you, my daughter, you will linger on in darkness and in doubt. As nightfall in winter that comes without a star. Here you will dwell, bound to your grief, under the fading trees, until all the world is changed and the long years of your life are utterly spent. Arwen... there is nothing for you here, only death. A im, -'erin veleth ln?
answer: Gerich meleth nn, ada.

question: What news?
answer: Our scouts report Saruman has attacked Rohan. Thodens people have fled to Helms Deep. But we must look to our own borders. Faramir, Orcs are on the move. Sauron is marshalling an army. Easterlings and Southrons are passing through the Black Gate.

question: How many?
answer: Some thousands. More come every day.

question: Whos covering the river to the north?
answer: We pulled 500 men at Osgiliath, but if the city is attacked, we wont hold it.

question: And where is your skulking friend? That gangrel creature. He had an ill-favoured look.
answer: There was no other. We set out from Rivendell with seven companions. One we lost in Mria. Two were my kin. A Dwarf there was also, and an Elf. And two men, Aragorn, son of Arathorn, and Boromir of Gondor.

question: Youre a friend of Boromir?
answer: Yes... for my part.

question: It will grieve you then to learn that he is dead.
answer: Dead? How? When?

question: The rock and pool is nice and cool, so juicy sweet! I only wish to catch a fish , so juicy sweet!
answer: Wait! This creature is bound to me. And I to him. He is our guide. Please, let me go down to him. Smagol. Master is here. Come, Smagol. Trust master. Come!

question: We must go now?
answer: Smagol, you must trust master. Follow me, come on. Come. Come, Smagol. Nice Smagol. Thats it. Come on. Dont hurt him! Smagol dont struggle! Smagol listen to me!

question: Master!! No! No!
answer: Where are you leading them? Answer me!

question: Smagol... Why does it cry, Smagol? Of course he did. I told you he was tricksy. I told you he was false. Master betrayed us. Filthy little hobbitses. They stole it from us.
answer: What did they steal?

question: We Ents have not troubled about the wars of men and wizards for a very long time. But now something is about to happen that has not happened for an age... Ent Moot.
answer: Whats that?

question: 'Tis a gathering.
answer: A gathering of what?

question: The Ents cannot hold back this storm. We must weather such things as we have always done.
answer: How can that be your decision?!

question: This is not our war.
answer: But you're part of this world! Arent you?! You must help, please! You must do something!

question: HALDIR!!
answer: Brace the gate! Make way! We cannot hold much longer.

question: How long do you need?
answer: Brace the gate!

question: Gimli!
answer: Come on! We can take em!

question: Its a long way.
answer: Toss me.

question: What?
answer: I cannot jump the distance! Youll have to toss me! Oh! Dont tell the Elf.

question: Not a word.
answer: ARGH!!

question: I will leave you at the western borders of the forest. You can make your way north to your homeland from there.
answer: Wait! Stop! Stop! Turn around. Turn around. Take us south!

question: South? But that will lead you past Isengard.
answer: Yes. Exactly. If we go south we can slip past Saruman unnoticed. The closer we are to danger, the farther we are from harm. Its the last thing hell expect.

question: What are you doing? Where are you going?!
answer: Aaarrgghh!!!

question: Its me. Its your Sam. Dont you know your Sam?
answer: I cant do this, Sam.

question: I know. Its all wrong. By rights we shouldnt even be here. But we are. Its like in the great stories, Mr. Frodo. The ones that really mattered. Full of darkness and danger they were. And sometimes you didnt want to know the end. Because how could the end be happy? How could the world go back to the way it was when so much bad had happened? But in the end, its only a passing thing, this shadow. Even darkness must pass. A new day will come. And when the sun shines it will shine out the clearer. Those were the stories that stayed with you. That meant something, even if you were too small to understand why. But I think, Mr. Frodo, I do understand. I know now. Folk in those stories had lots of chances of turning back only they didnt. They kept going because they were holding on to something.
answer: What are we holding on to, Sam?

question: I wonder if well ever be put into songs or tales.
answer: What?

question: I wonder if people will ever say, lets hear about Frodo and the Ring. And theyll say yes, thats one of my favorite stories. Frodo was really courageous, wasnt he, dad. Yes, my boy, the most famousest of hobbits. And thats saying alot.
answer: Huh, you left out one of the chief characters  Samwise the Brave. I want to hear more about Sam. Frodo wouldnt have got far without Sam.

question: Now Mr. Frodo, you shouldnt make fun. I was being serious.
answer: So was I.

question: Samwise the Brave.
answer: Smagol!
